description:
Every time I've been here the food is excellent and I get more to go.  The lychee martini is $6.50 and one is not enough.  

The price is right, food is delicious, and my bartender Hayden will give you excellent service.
author: Meagan M.

description:
Salty. I had the tofu miso soup and I had to add water. 

My companion ordered pho and the soup was room temperature. The meat was raw.  

I will never order from here again.
author: Angelica C.

description:
I've been going to the citrus club for over 10 years. All I get here is chicken soup, chicken soup, chicken soup! 
It's a simple but well flavored bowl of soup with thin rice noodles and pulled chicken. Love putting all the side items like bean sprouts, mint, chili peppers, and a squeeze of lemon. After all these years the quality hasn't really gone down like it happens in a lot of places. Love it!
author: Cartman P.

description:
I rarely go the Haight but when I do it always includes some noodles from The Citrus Club. I've always had excellent service and honest appraisals of what I was thinking of ordering. The servers actually tell you which dishes they like and don't like. How refreshing. 

Vegan friends turned me on to this place five years ago. This is one place where I honestly miss neither the dairy nor the meat. I usually order vegan here though I'm not a vegan. 

I usually get the coconut lime noodles. I almost never can finish them because the portion is so generous. I might wish for more vegetables but otherwise the flavor is great. 

Today I also had the BBQ tofu spring rolls. The tofu was grilled and the peanut sauce had a smoky bbq flavor. They were terrific in taste but so generously rolled that they were hard to cram in my eager mouth.  Yes I know that sounds dirty but that's your problem.

Go to Citrus Club. Enjoy some noodles.
author: Tim P.

description: Absolutely fantastic! The bowl of soup could feed at least 2, probably 3. Easy quiet atmosphere. The soup has a great simple broth. I got the egg drop without chicken. Delicious. Just what I needed on this cold rainy day
author: Marissa R.

description: This is the best garlic noodles ive ever had. Yum yum I was very impressed. It was a great experience coming here with friends.
author: Meron A.

description: The egg drop soup was mediocre with no flavor and overpriced. I was unable to finish the soup. Ingredients float in some warm water for $15 as loud music blasts. Service was friendly.
author: Tracey H.

description:
Sooooo- I just found a cigarette butt in my soup here. 

I don't even know how that gets there. 

Never returning.
author: Kaityn M.

description:
After revisiting SF years after we left, we had a great culinary adventure trying everything from off beat newcomers to celebrity chef establishments but honestly the place I was most interested in revisiting was this and it did not disappoint 

It is made for those chilly, damp SF days. An unassuming door leads to a small but cozy space with delicious food that is well priced!! 

Our table of four ordered edamame and 2 soup bowls leaving full with food to spare. The Garlic edamame was delicious and the soup was as good as I remember - the hot and sour has a kick but is super flavorful loaded with shrimp, tofu, noodles and veggies ! My kids enjoyed the Sa Choy soup as it was milder but still flavorful! 

Great washed down with their IPA selection - was so happy I revisited this place.
author: Sam P.

description: The Pad Thai here was excellent.  I know my PT's and they make it right. Properly sized noodles, great little fried tofu pieces and a multitude of interesting bits. You can eat a ton of it and not feel bloated, very light and refreshing. Large portions served on everything ordered! Good service, clean.  It's a bit of a utilitarian interior, but that makes it even more authentic... The food, your dinner companions and fellow diners engaging you in overheard conversations make for a marvelously entertaining experience, after all this is the Haight. Though I only drank a beer, they do have mixed drinks. I live near, this place has been here a long time and is a go-to place for us locals. I really like the noise level which is much quieter (with music) than so many "trendy" places, this is a place for conversations and not retarded shouting.
author: BLAK-TLR G.

description: Great little place!  I had the Hot and Sour noodle soup and it was excellent.  It's spicy but very good.  The serving size is large, waitstaff really nice.  Highly recommended.
author: Scott S.

description:
When your visits to a restaurant are spread out, it can be hard to form an opinion of it. I've been to Citrus Club a few times in the 6 years I've lived in SF. 

**The only redeeming thing about my meal from here the other night was the Thai Chicken Salad, which was very good.**

While I remember it smelling like piss the last time I dined in, I reasoned that this memory *was* from a while ago and maybe my experience would be different this time. Nope! Still smells of piss.

I wouldn't recommend eating inside this place, the decor/building is charming but everything feels unsanitary and gross (the bathroom is absolutely horrendous). 

If you order from here (preferably pick-up or delivery), DO NOT order the chicken or beef pho. I've had some mediocre/bland pho before but I think this is probably the worst I've ever encountered. My beef pho tasted like bland, dirty dish water. The Thai basil looked past its prime, the bean sprouts seemed less than fresh, and there was a lemon wedge in lieu of lime. They should honestly just take the pho off the menu.

Read some other reviews for recommendations on what to order for takeaway--Just don't get the pho.
author: Megan D.

description: One of those spots you go for your naughty carb fix. Delicious, saucy & generous portions.
author: Steven W.

description: If you want good Thai food this place is not for you. But if you want below average padthai while smelling pee, rodents running under the tables, extremely rude waitresses and extremely slow service this place is for you. This place sucks go to Ploy Thai instead. Way better than this so called restaurant.
author: Danny S.

description:
Thai/Asian-fusion food! I was so excited to come here after a recommendation from my coworker. A friend had shared this with me in the past, but this was my first time visiting. 

The food was definitely above average, a little oily in my experience, but still pretty good. My coworker recommended ordering ahead, but since I was going with a coworker, I figured it'd be easier to go there to figure out what we wanted - plus the website and yelp menu weren't working at the time (the website still doesn't).

For two noodle dishes, we had waited a little over a half hour, which took up my coworker's entire lunch period and then some. The server was very kind and offered us water while we waited at the bar for food (we ended up doing it to-go).

I definitely recommend ordering ahead, when possible, otherwise, you may be waiting for quite some time.

Food: 5/10
Staff: 8/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Value: 7/10
Overall: 7.5/10
author: Evan K.

description:
There are over 5000 restaurants in San Francisco. Go anywhere but here. The owner or head chef seems to think his lunch is more important than the customers. 20 minutes and still no noodles? Buh-bye!

You (should) know you're in trouble when the same person is handing you a menu, bussing tables, handling money, filling the ice bucket, and handling food; all without washing her hands between each task. Cross-contamination is the biggest cause of food borne illness. The kitchen operation also looked like a vector for disease; too much handling of multiple items, and no visible hand washing. Also, WAY too many one-star reviews.

Unless this place is a tax write-off, they should be out of business by Christmas.
author: Joseph T.

description:
I know this is San Francisco, and I know this is Haight St. but my husband and baby just had to run out of this establishment a few minutes ago because a big rat was running under the tables. 6/12/17 8:55PM. Maybe the rats noticed that there weren't many customers and thought it was closing/feasting time.

On a good note, the Warriors just won!!! Woohoo!! 
On a neutral note, the last few times I ate here the food was delicious. ()
author: Jessica B.

description: Great service. Food was even better. Had the garlic noodle with teriyaki chicken.  Also enjoyed the garlic edamame. Went during the week wasn't too busy and plenty of street parking available. Place doesn't look like much outside but definitely a hidden gem in the Haight.
author: R. G.

description: Served quickly. Staff and cook were friendly. Place was dark, run down and had some families inside. Ordered a basil shrimp dish. It was greasy. Shrimp had zero taste. Noodles were passable. Maybe people come here for the drinks. My food was definitely well below average for a SF restaurant.
author: Stuart R.

description:
Good food, slow service. Got the lemongrass shrimp dish with jade noodles. It was tasty, as others described it, a asian fusion linguine alfredo. It could've used some salt, but the plum sauce helped spruce it up.

My other eating party members got the:

Pad Thai - solid, but not the best I've ever had

A curry soup of some sort - huge portion and very good flavor, although again, maybe some salt to bring out the flavors more.

Our server was the only guy running the spot on a thursday, so my heart goes out to him, but we had to flag him down for everything, and it took a few tries usually b/c he had so many other people to wait on. It was annoying, but not the end of the world. 

Would definitely come again, especially for dinner. Didn't see any HH deals but wouldn't be surprised!
author: Ari F.

description: If you drink at this place, make sure you order water.  They automatically do not give water at the table. And the waiter will keep asking you if you want another drink.  It's a recipe for a hangover. Lol
author: Amanda B.

description: So delish! Amazing spot. Simply the best and lots of food for the price point. Such great soup. And really big bowls, like really BIG! Noms.
author: Asher B.

description: I've been coming here since 2006 and its been great. I think I may have had a few 'off' meals the past few times or maybe the cooks are skimping out on some imperative spices but the food is extremely bland. The veggies in the Tom Kha are minimal- just water flavored vermicelli noodles are what's left when you deconstruct the dish. The Cold Coconut Lime Noodles are stuck together in a ball in what seems to be a flavorless mayonnaise curry sauce (aka mayonnaise sauce). I had to ask for soy sauce which isn't something anyone should have to use on a dish like this. Beautiful presentation- terrible food- great service- horrible prices. Maybe ill come back and try something else.
author: Sarah T.

description: I stopped in at the Citrus Club for a quick lunch today and I was really pleased. A friend and I split the chicken lettuce wraps, a broccoli and beef noodle dish, and the shrimp hot and sour soup. Everything was good, but the hot and sour soup really stood out to me. The broth was so delicious and unique, it was spicy with a hint of lemongrass. It would be the perfect soup to get when coming down with a cold. The ice tea was great too! Already looking forward to coming back to get the soup sometime in the future.
author: Vanessa J.

description: I had the garlic beef and shiitake mushroom noodles and it was very tasty.Great ambience, tasty food, huge portions, and very affordable.I will definitely keep them in mind next time I have a hankering for noodles
author: Harriet A.

description:
One of the best San Francisco experience I had 
Their soups are huge and delicious I went there with my friends for dinner in a rainy day which was a perfect choice for such a day 

Their prices are really reasonable and our server was really friendly 

I will go back for sure!
author: Maha M.

description:
Full bar with Asian oodles of noodle food.  If you are looking to chow down on noodles, curry or stir-fried other noodles, then this will definitely hit the spot.  

Their Thai iced tea was too sweet for my liking. 

I love noodles and they make it good here, but it was not the noodles that I would go head over heels on.

Citrus salad was spot on as well as their shrimp spring rolls.  

A good noodle spot!
author: Tiffany D.

description: This was my first trip there, and I have to say it was pretty bomb, food came out quick and was hot and perfect fotr a cold weather. Only reason not for a fiver star was the beef in my soup tasted like rubber other than that we are gucci
author: Alex S.

description: I love this place. Have not eaten there in awhile since I moved away but always try to make it back when I visit. Favorite is the coconut curry soup but everything I have tried is delicious!  Plan on eating there soon again!
author: Katie H.

description: Chicken noodles and pad Thai were amazing! Shrimp spring roll starter were good too! Very good service as well.
author: Miranda L.

description:
A menu full of choices, huge portions, and reasonable prices.  My group had the peanut noodles, sweet & spicy tofy noodles, and cold bucketwheat noodles with lime and coconut.  We ate for 30 minutes and seriously didn't even make a dent in the dishes!  We boxed up the leftovers and had three more meals of out them!

The lime & coconut noodles were interesting, but I would recommend sticking with the classics!
author: Kelly E.

description: I mean zero complaints.  Citrus Club is tried and true reliable favorite.  The Hot Sour Soup is so damn good and basically medicine if you have a cold.  I eat this every time I feel sick and the spice knocks out all signs of sickness.   Please enjoy this staple on Haight.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: We went here for the first time, I have mixed feelings about this place. The service was good. I ordered the vegetarian tofu banh mi, and it had the perfect level of spicy and veggies. But, I wish the tofu had been hot or at least warm. My POM Sake Martini was good. However, I wish the place had been a bit cleaner too.
author: Jael V.

description: This is a review for their Pho and take-out. Picked up some beef pho that was like warm and lacking in flavor. I had to load it up with so many other sauces I happened to have at home. Also it was stingy on the extra veggies and fixing in that there were none, just bean sprouts. I won't be ordering take out here anymore. It's not the first time the take out has been lacking. When I dine-in the food is always great and the service is good. Wish there was some consistency.
author: Stella D.

description: Hubby and I come to The Citrus Club often. I love their coconut noodle soup with veggies. I do pick out the tofu because they are giant cubes, and I like mine much smaller. Their apps are great and cider is cheap!
author: A M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Chill environment, never too full of people, delicious food, and large portions. The Tom-Ka Thai Coconut soup is amaze.
author: Alexa E.

description: I love this place. Chow mein with crispy tofu is awesome. They have so many option for vegetarians. Quick, easy, and cheap with huge portion sizes.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Probably been here about 20 times in the past 3 years. 
Hot-Sour Shrimp noodle soup is bomb. I'm pretty sure I've ordered it just about every time I've been here. It definitely hits the spot.  Immediately delivers that warm feeling inside that we all know and love.
Thumbs up for the yum-yum noodle soups!
author: Stacy C.

description: Their food and lousy service are absolute shite. I would never recommend this poor excuse for Thai to anyone.  We had to wait 45 minutes before we could flag a waitress down just to get a refill on our beverages. Their waitresses seemed like they could care less about their jobs and would rather just text and play on their phones which they were so doing today when we went in. The food was really dry and tasted like ass. They should close this place down.
author: Taylor V.

description: This is the worst restaurant I've ever been to!! I even want to give negative star! Ok, so we went here after Halloween trick or treat. The waitress put us in a table right next to the restroom (yes, if people open the door it'll smash face). The smell wasn't so bad. But the worst part was the waitress. I asked for a bowl, she gave me this impatient face, and she never gave me the bowl. I ordered the tofu miso soup, how can miso soup go wrong!? It definitely doesn't taste like miso soup AT ALL!! Not only the food taste bad here, but also the service  is the worst! We are nice enough to give her 10% tips. When we are about to leave, the waitress took away the check and saw the tip she said "so cheap!" WTF!! "SO CHEAP!???!!!" Seriously! We gave you more than you deserve! You bitxx!!!!
author: Kelly L.

description: I just finished eating the beef noodle soup. The broth was very, very salty. I left most of it in my bowl. I actually feel sick right now. I told the waiter and left a tip. He didn't seem to care. I've eaten here a few times over the years. The prices have gone up but the food has gotten worse.
author: Z. M.

description: The food is very good and comes out quite fast. Service is friendly and they serve you water continuously. We ate inside but the temperature was on the low side, due to a draught.
author: Dorine H.

description: They got my order wrong. It was an online order so I don't know how they could get it wrong - disappointing...
author: Ian F.

description: Very dingy, dark and dirty too.  Has a sour, unclean smell and they could invest in some Windex to clean the windows.  I did not give it 1 star due to the polite and friendly service, but the food is probably the worst Thai food I've ever had.  Seriously, for a place specializing in noodles, how could you get it so wrong?  The udon noodles were mushy and bland.  The pad thai had no flavor, tasted like mushy noodles mixed with ketchup.  The Thai iced tea was ok, did not have a nice depth of flavor, tasted weak.  I don't understand the 5-star reviews:  did we hit upon a night when the regular chefs were out?  I don't like writing negative reviews but I don't understand how this place stays in business when there are so many great Asian and Thai restaurants in San Francisco.  Unless you like very bland, flavorless food I would suggest you pick another spot.
author: Lina A.

description:
So rude.  My boyfriend and I walked in, the waitress handed us two menus and didn't walk us in, just told us to sit wherever.  There were a bunch of tables in the back open so we picked a 4 top that looked a little more comfortable.  
2 minutes later a group of 3 walked in and the manager came over and ordered us to find another table.  Let me clarify that there were 2 other tables available and large enough for them to sit at.  We walked out, but not before she berated us in front of the whole restaurant for not picking a smaller table.  No thanks, I'll give my business to another establishment.
author: Natalie C.

description:
We like to go walking a lot more lately, and often end up in the Haight, or even further. At least once, so close to Golden Gate Park, we stopped here for a meal on the way back home.

My items ordered were the following:
-Marmalade Coconut/Lemongrass Shrimp: Sweet peas, onions and lemongrass. Tossed in our coconut sauce with Jade (spinach) noodles
-Cocktail: Cosmopolitan

What I particularly appreciated about my shrimp dish were two things: 1) there was an enormous amount of green noodles for an inexpensive price, and 2) I love shrimp! That single dish took at least 30something minutes to attempt consuming, and I couldn't finish it, but I sincerely tried to.

I will be visiting Thailand for the first time next week. Out of everywhere I've tasted Thai food, including Lers Ros, Jitlada, Sai Jai Thai and Kin Khao, I know this is not the #1 spot for authenticity, but it is very affordable and enjoyable.

Sidenote: after visiting here, I learned my grandfather lived for a time just a few blocks away. I am more of a local to the Haight than I ever knew!

Final Rating: 3.5
author: Garett T.

description:
Thai Asian fusion, we stopped here for lunch while up shopping in the Haight Ashbury. There's a wide variety of noodles, from soups to stir fried to salad and cold noodles. There's also a really good variety of vegetarian options which I appreciated as it made it easy to find some variety of things I liked.

Despite the hour, it wasn't overly busy (it was towards the late end of the lunch hour on a Saturday) yet our food came out pretty slow compared to others around us. A waitress commented a few minutes before it came out that it was on its way, but this was 15-20 minutes after we'd placed our order, so we were getting pretty impatient by then. 

The food itself is pretty good and the portions are good sized. We had more than enough for lunch with bits left over. There were a few things on the menu that looked interesting and I'd definitely like to try out if we make it back up here again.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Such a warm, welcoming meal! It took us forever to decide what to order because everything looked so good, but our server was very patient as we decided on their curry chicken noodle soup and a noodle dish with beef, garlic, shiitake mushrooms, and other veggies. They were both great and delivered incredibly quickly, The soup was especially delicious, with a lot of great, comforting flavor, and splitting two dishes was the perfect amount of satisfying food for two people. Great service and great food.
author: AJ P.

description:
I've been living in upper haight for 2 years and have passed this by regularly. I decided to stop by one day and ordered the hot and sour soup. The portions were massive and the soup was one of the best that I've had.  

I find myself going back a couple times a week to try new things off the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. You can't go wrong with the soups, garlic beef and mushroom noodles, peanut noodles or the coconut curry chicken. Hidden gem, for sure. Great service, friendly staff. Highly recommended.
author: Daniel C.

description: The garlic edamame was a hit. Nice size portions. Needed sodium to both of our dishes. Every dish I saw, looked very good. Awkward seating, maybe refurbish needed. That was my biggest concerned.
author: Tammy S.

description: Hidden gem in the Haight not far from entrance to golden gate park and Whole Foods. Amazing soups!
author: Sandra L.

description: Sweet little dive atmosphere, we sat at the bar, that dude was super candid and nice! Great noodles and  sweet music, made me get in a dancing mood!
author: Uriel L.

description:
TL;DR:
Not crazy expensive; in a great location.
The pad thai was a large portion, spicy, and some of the best I've found.
Try the avocado summer rolls - who knew?
Only order the Khao Soi if you're very hungry - but it is quite the palatable selection. 

Recently, I had the pleasure of visiting San Francisco and spending a good deal of time in The Haight. Growing up with a culturally retrospective eye, I was fully excited to finally visit Haight-Ashbury, and see the Stonehenge of 60s counter-culture. Yet, I soon realized that the restaurants and diners abundant in the area were difficult to sift through. Most were pricey for seemingly commonplace dishes, and certainly influenced by the affluent tourists' billfolds. Of course, in an effort to find where the locals were loyal to, I turned to friendly Yelpers. 

The Citrus Club might be easy to glance over when you're walking down the street, but as per a raving endorsement, I paid a visit. Super glad that I did. 

Inside, it's trendy and modern, the lights are low, and the ambiance is welcoming. Taking a seat at the bar, my comrade and I had a front row seat to the chefs and their woks. We ordered avocado summer rolls, some sort of sweet bok choy and mushroom dish, tofu pad thai, and the khao soi. The bok choy/mushroom arrangement came out first, and although it was probably a little sweeter than I would have preferred, it was a delicious appetizer and gave me confidence in the rest of the selections. The summer rolls were fresh, large, and perfectly accented by avocado (I'd never tried avocado summer rolls before). Finally, the pad thai and khao soi came out. Immediately, we noticed that the portions were enormous, but as hungry as we were, we were happy to make some very large dents in the dishes. The pad thai was one of the better renditions of the dish that I've had in recent memory, and the khao soi was a large bowl of delicious broth and freshly flushed ingredients. In the end, we walked away with leftovers, and paid a very small bill (can't get much better than that).
author: Chase T.

description:
We walked in here because it was the first place we saw after I'd said, "I'm hungry." Smart man, that boyfriend, because he knows that "I'm hungry" turns into "I'm hangry" (hungry/angry) in 2.5 seconds flat.

We sat at the counter and I ordered a big ol' bowl of veggie soup with soba noodles: http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=65yGwlmbJCHcZf5WuYYMmg&userid=cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg. That's the understatement of the year, because this bowl was GIGANTOR! Maybe it's because they knew I'd be hangry, too?

It was just OK, but since I was hungry, I managed to put-away at least half of the monstrous-sized soup. With broccoli, cabbage, carrots, mushrooms, tofu, and soba noodles in a miso broth, I could've easily continued eating from this bowl for dinner that night (and lunch the following day).

Good bang for your buck, but not as amazingly tasty as you'd hope.
author: Adena B.

description: I've only eaten one time from citrus club and the food was incredibly disappointing. The Pho was almost inedible.  The spices were so strong in the broth that I couldn't taste anything but cinnamon.  A giant hot bowl of cinnamon broth.  The taste carried over into the noodles.  The meat was about the only edible part of the dish. Additionally we ordered the Pad Thai.  The flavors were all off.  Hardly any of the sweet tamarind taste that american pad thai is so famous for. Instead the chef put way too much green onions into the dish so that noodles tasted like nothing but onion and the lemon I squeezed on top.  Very disappointed. We came to Citrus Club because of the rave reviews, but now I am wondering how anyone can eat there.
author: Garrett M.

description: this is my favorite noodle place! they have such a wide selection and i can't wait to try their other dishes! the service could be improved, but it definitely doesn't hinder the experience. I recommend this place to anyone who is visiting Haight!
author: Sara H.

description:
Their garlic beef and shitake noodles made me realize there is a such thing as too much soy sauce and too much garlic (blasphemy coming from my asian-american mouth).

Their server deciding to add a little extra $ for himself to my credit card bill despite my having left a standard and respectable lunchtime tip made me realize this is not a place to come back to.

Diner beware.
author: Teresa T.

description: The Thai coconut tofu soup is AMAZING!!!  It's honestly so creamy and not too filling. I died and went to heaven eating this! They have good mojitos too
author: B G.

description: I don't get why the 3.5 star rating for this place when it's absolutely delicious & the prices are awesome. My go to is the short ribs with garlic noodles and my bf gets the hot and sour soup (sooo good). He subs chicken for the shrimp it comes with. I've had a few other things like the Pho, dumpling soup, and some of the noodle dishes. All really good. Portions are huge. And yes, I know service can be patchy. They usually only have 1 or 2 people working at a time so as long as you are nice to them and ask for what you need they'll get to you as soon as possible. It's not a huge restaurant so it's not hard to flag someone down.
author: Caitlin G.

description:
The portions are gigantic. I got the beef pho and it was quite decent. The noodles could have bit cooked a bit less, I think. I tried a bite of the other dishes and they were really creamy and kind of "nuekki" as the Koreans would say it (basically meaning that it has too much heavy sauce). 

I still enjoyed it. They play exciting pop music, which did not go too well with the food and atmosphere, but I totally dealt with it.
author: Juliana P.

description:
This is some pretty damn good pho'
Tried the GF's hot and sour veggie soup, awesome!

Hope they get they get their health code issue under control.. Serving food out of a dirty kitchen is gross, rude and dangerous.
author: Flix N.

description: Did not enjoy this restaurant. The service was terrible, the waiter was an ass, and the food was uninspiring. There are far better places to go, and while the location is in a touristy area, convenience does not make it worth the trouble. I will say the serving sizes were large, which is nice. Essentially, buyer beware.
author: Aspen H.

description:
Food was great everything was awesome till I used the restroom right after one of the cooks. To my surprise I noticed the cooks had failed to flush the toilet after going #2! Makes me question if he failed to do something else (i.e. Wash his hands).

I hope the food stays down. Other than this sanitary issue I really enjoyed the food the ambience and the wait staff. Not sure if I'll go back though.
author: Max R.

description:
Pregnant and starving, I was craving noodles. I would literally do anything for a steaming bowl of hot noodles. So I called up citrus club and ordered take out. One Chicken Noodle Soup. How long will it take? Ten minutes. 
TEN MINUTES??? 
Score. 
Hopped out of bed as fast as I could and ran, who am I kidding, WADDLED down there as fast as I could. It was already ready by the time I got there, and to my great delight the had wrapped everything individually (chicken, broth, noodles, bean sprouts, basil). $10.58? PLEASE, TAKE my money. When I got home I dumped half of it into a bowl. Why only half? Well because you need a cauldron to fit all of that yumminess into one bowl. So, long story short, I love this place. It's an Asian fusion, so don't be expecting authentic Thai food. 
Yum factor +1
Service +1
Size +1 
Price +1
Take out speed +1 
5 stars. Easy.
author: Rebekah H.

description:
1. This place is more of a mediocre, fake thai food restaurant. 

2. Absolutely NOT a club.

3. Although you can order drinks at this so called club; prices are decent.

4. You sit yourself rather than waiting to be seated by the server.

Our server last night (3/7/15) didn't catch her name... was kind off odd. She accidentally knocks off my fork off the table while passing; no acknowledgments whatsoever.

5. Wait 10-15 minutes for the server to take your order. Wait a total of 30 mins before receiving your order. 

Our server comes back with replacement fork...cool

Tip: Make sure you check if your meat is cooked properly. (My meat was RAW most parts) I ordered the korean short ribs with a side of garlic noodles but they served it on the same plate. 

I wouldn't have noticed so easily since the room is dark and dim. I had to take a picture with the flash on just to check.

I call the server and told her my meat is raw. No apology whatsoever; takes my plate away.

Why the hell is my meat raw even after waiting 30 mins?! SMH

If you are looking for a real authentic thai food place to eat, THIS IS NOT the place. Save yourself the time and get some real food elsewhere.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
I am addicted to their soup andI crave it all the time. 

However, let it be known that their garlic edamame is the best thing in the world. And I have tried everything in the whole world to make that claim.  ;-) Really. Soooo good.
author: Sunny C.

description: Nice find on Ashbury. Portions were Yuuuuuuge, and it all tastes pretty good. We started with some garlic edamame, which was amazing, and so freaking addictive. We then split a chicken Pho, which was giant. For mains we ordered the marmalade shrimp, and salmon with garlic noodles. Both plates were very big, and we couldn't finish them even as a party of 4. The salmon was cooked nicely, and noodles were nice. The shrimp were nice too. The lychee iced tea was just average however. But overall, a great affordable find.
author: Onik R.

description:
I'm willing to give things a second chance. In all fairness over the years (almost a decade) I've had some not so bad experiences at citrus club.  The first was probably the best. But it's gone down hill over the years with really poor service on some occasions and completely uncooked food on other. I was compelled to go back on a rainy night not so long ago. 
While I was waiting for the food I was lucky enough to talk to the owner. She was chillin at the front counter having some tea. The first thing I asked her about was the closing of Kan Zaman across the street. She gave me the inside details on that, I had been wondering for a long long time. I was going to let her know about the miss happenings at the club over the years but I just couldn't do it. Then my food was ready and I left. 

The noodles are soggy, the vegetable's are undercooked but the flavor is good.  The meats overcooked and dry. It's convenient to go her sometimes, I wish he food would step up and represent.
author: Ben M.

description:
I'd been told about this place by a friend and was excited to try it. It smelled so good when I entered! There were plenty of open tables but the tables are all literally on top of each other so they can seat as many people as possible. Great for them but not ideal for customers who don't want to be involved in the convo of the couple next to them. Next time I will sit at the counter so I don't have to shimmy past three tables to leave.

Great beer selection on tap.

Wide variety on the menu which was nice but hard to make a choice. They all sounded so good. The waiter helped guide me into the Shanghai noodles. Really happy with the choice. Not too saucy, tender beef, noodles not so long that it was hard to eat with chopsticks, book choy small enough to eat easily. All good.

Once we got our drinks, which took a while, the service picked up. 

All in all, fun and tasty time. I'd go back.
author: Tera K.

description:
Gotta preface this by saying I had Thai twice in one day- and the other Thai I had before my dinner at Citrus Club was at Ler Ros. Ler Ros is in an altogether different category than Citrus Club and I didn't come here expecting anything vaguely "authentic." But even so, Citrus Club served up some objectively mediocre food in a zero ambience/character venue. The chicken noodle soup was lukewarm, as though it had been sitting around for 10 minutes- a cardinal sin for pho! Definitely no where near warm enough to soften the raw bean sprouts. I'm not sure how that was even possible (other than it actually sitting out in the cold) given we were sitting a few feet from the open kitchen. The broth itself was alright- not too heavy in thickness or in saltiness- and came in a big ass bowl with a healthy serving of chicken. 

We also ordered the Basil Shrimp special which was supposed to come with stir-fried ramen. The dish was drenched in a sweet and mildly spicy brown sauce and the noodles were not ramen, but rather the super thin cheap yellow Chinese noodles you buy from Ranch 99. Portion size again was large, but didn't make up for the fact that the you couldn't pay me to eat the noodles. Finally, the $4.50 price point on the Thai iced teas is one of the highest I've seen, ever (not at all commensurate with the divey, no frills venue). The iced teas were decent and as a semi-lactose intolerant customer, I appreciate the fact that they use soy milk (although shouldn't they give ppl a heads up in case ppl have a soy allergy?). But they could definitely lower the price point by a solid fifty percent. Folks keep raving about CC as a cheap, no frills comfort food spot. But it's neither. Spots like Ler Ros, which serve up far tastier and more complex dishes, have the same, if not a lower, price point. Another example of confusing Bay Area yelp reviews!
author: Jen H.

description: Saw that Yelp gave a warning about the poor food safety warning but I walked in and saw that they're all up to date now.  I come here almost once a week being that I just moved one block away from here.  Portions are really large so you won't leave hungry.  I really liked their shrimp spring rolls and the wonton soup.  Pho isn't that great compared to a traditional Viet pho joint.  Will keep coming back to try the rest of the dishes.
author: Ted Y.

description:
Little hole in the wall place in Haight with some great Asian food! I loved the variety in what they served- everything from Thai to Japanese. I stopped in here on a freezing night (I'm from LA so it seemed freezing to me) for something warm & I got it! 

The garlic edamame was SO good but only for real garlic lovers - it's a lot of flavor in there. I also tried the Tom kha soup which was perfectly flavored and had tons of veg. The chicken teriyaki on garlic noodles was also delicious! I also had a special, Thai basil noodles with shrimp, but unfortunately didn't get as much flavor as I would have liked. 

Definitely worth 4 stars! It's a cute, romantic little place so would be great for a date night.
author: Kirby B.

description: I ordered the pad thai with chicken. The pad thai noodles were good but the chicken was awful. So dry it was inedible, and tasted like it came out of a bag frozen. I told our waitress and she still charged me for it. The Tom Kha soup with shrimp was very good. Not traditional (came with rice noodles) but very tasty. Overall average experience.
author: Rachel W.

description:
NOODLES!!! This is the spot to get your noodle lovin on.. 

I have dined here on many a dank, dark day.. when the weather calls for a nice hot steamy bowl of noodle soup.. 

I recently had such a bowl of their house Chicken Pho which promised, "just like your mom's chicken soup" and heartily delivered.. The rice noodles were perfect, toothsome, and slippery.. the broth was delicious and the bits of chicken were soft and tasted like they were roasted prior to being put in the soup..The large bowl was more than enough for two.. yummm..The avo-spring rolls were really tasty as well :)
author: Sara F.

description: Basic western-ized noodles. Large portions but lacking in flavor and authenticity. It is a pretty dark and dingy place.
author: Rex L.

description:
Great location to get a good drink and cheap food before some bohemian debauchery on Haight street. 
The portions are generous and are very noodle-centric so as to give you the carbs you'll need to survive the night of drinking you have ahead of you. 
Prices are cheaper than other venues in the area but due to the small size of this place you may have a long wait on your hands especially on the weekends. 
My go to so far has been the korean short ribs over garlic noodles. The garlic noodles aren't that great but the short ribs are especially flavorful with smoky/sweet overtones and paired with one of their appetizers such as the thai chicken salad or bbq tofu spring rolls I find myself in a better mood every time I leave here.
author: Norris T.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area. Being a vegetarian they have a lot of different dishes that I enjoy eating. One of my favorites is the garlic edamame. I also really enjoy the soups and spring rolls. I eat here at least two or three times a month. It's so good I drive from Martinez just to experience this excellent cuisine!
author: Dave S.

description: I've tried the place twice now and I've been so underwhelmed both times. First time I just abandoned my slop half way through the bowl and left. Everything was so overcooked it was tasteless mush. Second time the service was awful, as in, what does a person have to do to get the counter wiped clean an order in and cold beer please?........ food was better this time, as in just about mediocre. The satay sauce was the worst I've ever had, obviously from a big plastic tub, no love in the cooking. Check your bill too, my boyfriend, just last night, was charged for a soda he never ordered a double helping of Jalapeños he had asked for but never received. Three strikes, I'm out.
author: Susan C.

description: All dishes were delish, cocktails were great, ambiance was cool.  Minus two stars for the server being catty, inattentive, and plain rude when she dropped the check.  We were a small party of three, in and out in less than an hour, and the only thing we asked for the entire meal was a refill of our waters since we ordered spicy noodles.  Apparently that was too hard for her or just way too inconvenient, becuase she rolled her eyes and never came back until we asked for the bill, which we had to get up and ask the bartender for.  Here's a tip: I've been a server, and I get sometimes your days suck, but don't take it out on your customers.
author: Laura Jean R.

description: Place used to be much better, I have been going since it opened.  But recently went there with two others, after waiting for ONE HOUR a large table came available but the very rude waitress would not let us have it, she tried to squeeze us into a table fit for two near the bathroom, saying "we have to save the larger tables." No one was waiting but us and 2 of our party were seniors so you would think after a long wait and no one waiting they would let us have the table we wanted But no, this waitress--and hope she has been fired by now--had to show her hostile attitude. We left and will never go back after having dined there about once every two weeks for many years.   Avoid this place until they learn a bit about customer relations.  They really were very, very rude and unreasonable.
author: Osama B.

description: One of my favorite places to eat at in the SF. Food was delicious and the portions sizes were quite generous too. Parking was pretty easy too, at least it was every time I've been here.
author: Jonathan L.

description: We came in the restaurant before heading back home. It is our first time here. Ambience was good. We ordered the Vietnamese Spring rolls and the peanut sauce is a bit too salty. I ordered the vegetable noodle soup ($9.95) and added shrimp for $2.50. We also ordered the Burmese Curry wok-tossed noodle. That was pretty good. The veggie noodle was good cuz it has tons of veggies. The broth though lacked taste. All in all, we had better fried noodle and noodle soup. Surprising for an Asian restaurant in SF. I have expected better food here!! 2 bowls of noodle soup and 1 fried noodle dish came up to about $40! Prob won't come back again....
author: S S.

description: It is ok, but not the best noodles I had in the Bay Area
author: Cristina F.

description:
Citirus Club, Is a sleeper of a place. I don't really fancy asian dining.
I do like noodles and soup. and fairly reasonable pricing.
That's what this place provides, the food is good and tasty, artsy, and affordable.

The place is suprisingly spacious inside. Good for dates, not good for small children. Good for cheap dates. ;)
author: Michael R.

description:
This is consistently one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

Tiny place, but somehow have never had trouble getting seated quickly. Service is prompt for both take out and eating in. I have only ever ordered one thing on the menu. The peanut noodles...they are so delish, I cannot bring myself to branch out and order anything else. Incredibly cheap for the portion sizes as well. Looove this hidden gem on Haight.
author: Christine E.

description:
I came here for lunch and ordered the Tom Ka-Thai Coconut Tofu Soup with chicken. The portion size was huge. The rice noodles were way over cooked and mushy. The veggies were under cooked. There was an ok amount of chicken in the dish. The coconut broth was ok but I don't know how anyone could drink all that soup in the huge bowl.   

Service was ok. I think I was there right when they opened because they were playing some Spanish music at first and then after a while changed to their regular background music. It was kinda empty when I got seated but the restaurant started filling up by the time I left.
author: Alexander L.

description:
The Thai spot I have begun to frequent for lunch during the work week is closed on Mondays, so I decided to try out the pad thai at Citrus Club, only a couple stores away. The ambience was dark and had a bar-vibe to it. I am a pad thai fanatic and order this dish first each time I try a new noodle joint. I ordered to go. 

I didn't have to wait long, maybe 5-10 minutes for my order to be ready. My container was stuffed with a hefty portion of pad thai, lots of chicken and large chunks of tofu. From first glance, it looked appetizing; however, upon consumption it only turned out to be mediocre in flavor. Everything was cooked correctly, had adequate heat, just didn't quite have that addicting pop to it that I look for in my pad thai. The Thai food restaurant a few doors down has that addicting flavor, but the portions are slightly smaller, slightly less ingredients (no tomato), and is cheaper. If only Citrus Club worked on their pad thai sauce a bit more, it could be great!  Until then, it's back to my regular spot to get my fix.
author: Russell S.

description:
I actually happened onto The Citrus Club on accident. My dinner was meant to be across the street at another restaurant but the wait was too long. With stomach growling and fingers yelping, my eyes caught a glimpse of the word "Noodle Bar" written across the street. Now anybody that knows me knows that I am absolutely in love with noodles, so it was pretty obvious once I saw this place that my friends and I would wind up here. 

We got here relatively late, around 10'ish, but the kitchen was still open. And the bar was DEFINITELY open. Even before we ordered our meals, we had ordered ourselves a round of sake bombs. For $6.50 a person, we got enough sake to give 4 people 2 shots and a pitcher of Sapporo. Not too bad. The entrees came out to about $10/person and were pretty filling. I got (and 2 of my friends got) the shrimp wonton soup and it was HUGE. None of us finished and this was after a long night at the rock climbing wall so that's a testament to how big the bowl of soup was. The actual soup wasn't amazingly delicious but sometimes quantity can make up for quality, you know? 

In terms of noodle soups, there are restaurants in the city with vastly better noodle soups but Citrus Club definitely tops it when it comes to quality. And the atmosphere of the place makes it great for a late night meal with friends, especially if you get the alcohol coming.
author: Philip W.

description: The portion was ridiculously huge. Couldn't stop eating Garlic butter edamame, also Jade noodle got some good flavor. And I liked cozy atmosphere and friendly staffs. I wasn't impressed by my egg dropped noodle but I am happy enough to come back.
author: May Y.

description: Came here to try the noodle dish because my friend loves the coconut lemon chicken.  I had the tofu curry noodle dish.  Bland dish, nothing special.  Interesting place, had lots of people coming in and out.  The place was a little dark but played great music.  May come back to try other dishes potentially.  I wish they had rice dishes.
author: Anh N.

description: Came for dinner and wasn't very impressed. I was disappointed with my Korean short ribs, which didn't have much flavor. Apparently the pho was really underwhelming as well. There are a million other places to get these types of dishes, so Citrus Club would never be my first stop. The sake margaritas, however, were pretty good.
author: Sara M.

description: My husband and I came to eat here today and it was delicious. We were greeted by the waiter and given menus. This place you can seat yourself once given menus. We ordered the Vietnamese spring rolls. They were fresh and delicious. The peanut sauce had a bit of a kick to it. We also ordered the shanghai noodles and ginger salmon.  Very nice portions that I believe you can share with another person. Overall, very pleased and will be returning.
author: Samantha M.

description: Full disclosure: I haven't been back here in a couple of years, but back when we lived in SF, this was our absolutely fav! Our top choices: Garlic Edamame, Garlic Beef & Shitake Mushrooms, and the Lemon-Coconut Chicken. Some good sake cocktails too. Only reason I say 4/5 is for the long waits with no space to wait in, that is the only thing that kept us from going even more.
author: Mandi C.

description:
This place has really gone downhill. We moved out of the area and used to go here all the time. Came back after a few years, super excited for soup, and were completely disappointed. The pho was bland. The edamame was overcooked, mushy, and soaked in some sort of oil. The short rib garlic noodle dish was not exciting. The meat had a good flavor but you could tell it was not a high quality meat. 

The place is grimy. Bathroom is dirty. I know it's the Haight so you should expect some grime. Even given that expectation, this place needs a serious clean. 

Service was very friendly.
author: K C.

description:
Server recommended 2 noodle dishes: 'Burmese coconut curry chicken' and the 'Teriaki chicken'.  Both were tremendous, tasty, generous portions at a fair price.  
They also accomodated a request for a small wonton soup as an entrée even if it wasn't on the menu!
We were very satisfied!
author: Pascal B.

description:
FOOD: I ordered the house of pad thai and it was very delicious. I'm not a fan of spicy food; however, the amount of spice in this dish was made to perfection. The noodles were not soggy and the portions were really good! They didn't hustle you either when it came to the meats and veggies. Sometimes restaurants like to add more veggies to make it look bigger. Pricing is decent as well. Our bill came out to be $40 with two dishes and an appetizer with drinks. 

SERVICE: Service was very prompt. Although, I think they should wear uniforms or some sort of company logo shirt. The waiter we had looked as though he was a normal customer. I was confused at first, but he was very good at what he did. 

ATMOSPHERE: I have one dislike about this place. PLEASE CHANGE THE MUSIC. When I went during dinner time, it was nice to have a candlelit dinner, but the music just did not fit the scene. I mean, I love my oldies, but with an asian-fusion ambience, it just does not match. Overall, the decor is modern with their wooden tables and chairs. Very cozy. 

OVERALL: I definitely recommend this place to get your fix on noodles. It's a good little date night or a hangout with friends.
author: Isabel N.

description:
Not authentic Thai or whatever they're trying to position themselves as. It was unfortunate that I got take out for chicken pad Thai and when I got home, realized they had given me a veggie pad Thai--e.g. I paid more for a cheaper menu item. Either way, it did not taste as pad Thai should. The noodles stuck together, the curry the noodles was supposed to be in was not on point. The tofu was dry and the bean sprouts didn't feel cooked. For the veggie pad Thai, they made the interesting choice of adding tomatoes, which did not mix in well with the overall taste. 

Maybe I've just been spoiled by good Thai food from Berkeley but this is not a keeper in my book. But +1 for the effort, decor, and friendly service.
author: Eddie L.

description: Cheap eats on Haight & Ashbury.  I had an orange-mint cold noodle bowl with shrimp.  It was satisfying, and I wasn't overly stuffed.  I want to come back here and try to pad thai.
author: Vira P.

description: I dropped in about a week or two ago from a fellow Yelp review. I typed in 'pho soup Haight Street' an found them. So glad I did. Mmmm super tasty, and so much I couldn't finish it ! No really ! Now it's been a while and I'm feeling like I'm overdue ! Think I'll pop in tonight. Cold beer, good service, great noms ! A+
author: Jimmy D.

description:
A great first visit. Had the garlic beef & shitake wok bowl and it was delicious. I don't typically crave asian food (hence the 3 stars) but this was a nice find and I will definitely be back.

Food - very good
Staff - friendly & helpful
Price - moderate
author: David C.

description: We were parked outside this restaurant so as I was waiting for my passengers I started reading the menu and thought everything sounded good and the prices were reasonable. I ordered a pad thai. It was a lot of food, but the noodles were overcooked and stuck together. The sauce was really sweet and not much flavor. I ordered it with shrimp and there were barely enough. About a few hours later I could tell my stomach was happy as it was getting cramped up pretty good and I could feel the fever setting in. This wasn't going to be good.
author: Vince L.

description: My experience here was pretty underwhelming.  This might be a good place to eat if you aren't picky or you're on a tight budget as the portion size is pretty high.  We ordered spicy lemon chicken coconut noodles and it was absolutely bland....not spicy at all.  The noodles were over cooked and why was there parmesan cheese on this dish?? Was that parmesan or coconut? I can't tell because it didn't taste like anything. That really confused me.  We ordered the Tom Ka soup and while it was better - still pretty flavorless.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here for the 2nd time recently and was satisfied again! 

Servers are mellow and responsive. Food portions are generous. Food quality is better than average. Specialty drinks are a bit pricey, but overall prices are reasonable. 

Garlic beef and shiitake mushrooms: a little on the salty side, but fabulous and filling.
Avocado spring rolls: very fresh ingredients
Vietnamese iced coffee: delicious and refreshing

Great place for a date night or casual dinner with friends.
author: Michelle M.

description: I visited while in town with friends for dinner. I ordered a coconut curry and it came out in the biggest bowl ever! It was so delicious I wish I was able to eat more. The rest of our party also loved their dishes and large portions. We could have gotten by with ordering 2 dishes rather than 4. The service was great. Ambiance was chill and casual. I would highly recommend the ginger tea - delicious. I would recommend.
author: Tessa E.

description: I love this place!!! Let's start with their tom kha soup. It's just the best. I love noodles in my soup. I like ordering the veggies and tofu as well. This place never lets me down.
author: Emmy M.

description: One of the nice club in sf. Every time I came here it is like a first time I am being here. Usually it is good to come with the friends in here. Will be coming here more often.
author: Pramod G.

description: We liked this place so much we went twice in as many days. The food was delicious (especially the garlic edamame!), the service was prompt, and the selection was great. I think my favorite dish of the several we tried was the marmalade coconut lemongrass shrimp noodle bowl; it was fantastic. The beer selection was small but all the choices were spot on. Would definitely recommend this spot to any visiting Haight Ashbury.
author: Beth M.

description:
Great, spicy, flavorful soups!  Whenever I go in, I *always* order the Sweet & Sour Shrimp Noodle Soup.  It's like a shrimp Pho, and it's always delicious!

Not sure about anything else, though.
author: Michael D.

description:
Eye'ed this place for quite some time now and my friend decided that today was the day to try it out! We went at about 3:40pm on a weekday, so of course the place would be relatively slow. Thank god because I heard that the lines could get long. Upon arrival, I waited for my friend as the server allowed me to look over the menu until my friend got there. I already had an idea of what I wanted. I like how they have different menus for the different times of the day. 

Once seated, I knew I wanted the watermelon sweet iced tea, GET IT! You won't regret it one bit. We ordered the beignet flight(a sample of each) original, chocolate, Granny Smith apple, and of course the crawfish beignet. I knew I had to try the crawfish because that's what they were famous for, but hey why not sample everything. My favorite would have to be the crawfish and the original. I know it's weird, but it think the simple pleasures in life are kept simple. We also ordered the shrimp and grits since the 'in between' menu wasn't that large of a selection. The server also asked us if we wanted a side of biscuit with the grits. We said sure, knowing we weren't huge fans of biscuit. But, I was unhappy when I found out that it was an extra $2.25 and I wish the serve told me since we were all loaded up on carbs from the beignets. I mean, nonetheless the biscuit was good with the shrimp and grits. I've never had grits before, so this wasn't a disappointment. The shrimps were nicely seasoned too. The bill for 2 watermelon sweet tea, beignet flight, and shrimp was grits totaled out to be $33. Which wasn't bad at all. We were both definitely fully stuffed. 

Definitely come back whenever it isn't busy, although parking may not be the best.
author: Audrey K.

description: I love the garlic noodles with ginger salmon, but I think the price is now up to $17 which I think is just too much. Tonight I tried the coconut spinach noodles with shrimp and I definitely will not be ordering that dish again. It was bland. Oh well, I should have just stuck to what I know is good. My husband loves the soups.
author: Amy J.

description:
Paid Citrus Club another visit a few weeks ago. Still wonderfully tasty, giant portions. This update is mostly for the citrus punch.

When I think "punch", thoughts of red or orange liquid comes to mind. It doesn't necessarily have to be served in a bowl, but something that resembles the stuff you got as a kid. I guess I was imagining this to be like Hi-C only way more fresh?

The punch is made with lots of blended ice. Similar to that of a pina colada or mixed drink. The juice itself is very tart! Like, no sugar tart. Between that and the mountain of ice upon which it was served, it was a very odd drink. Not what I had expected at all!

Save yourself from the punch and stick with water or beer/wine. The food speaks for itself!
author: Abby S.

description: Pad Thai was pretty good! Thai tea was delicious. Server was kinda rude. But overall a good experience and pretty moderately good food.
author: Crystal R.

description:
OH MAAAH GAHHHHHDDDD!!!

Me and my honey went here for a date night last night around 5-6 P.M. When we arrived we were greeted immediately and sat down in the back room since we wanted some privacy. Let me just say that this place is PERFECT for a romantic date night. The lights were nice and dimmed, there were candles on the table, and the music was very relaxing and calm, perfect Haight street spot! 

I got the Lychee iced tea and downed it probably in like two minutes, HELLA BOMB. My boyfriend had never had a lemon drop martini before so we each got one of those as well, (he downed his drink before I could even take a sip of mine, hehe, he was thiiirsty!) 

We started with the chicken skewers appetizer, let me just tell you, BEST PEANUT SAUCE I HAVE EVER HAD, HANDS DOWN!!! Perfect way to start the meal. 

My boyfriend ordered the chicken noodle soup and I ordered the hot and sour soup with tofu and seasonal vegetables. Let me just start by saying NOW THAT IS A BOWL OF SOUP! I'm sick of going to all of these janky ass pho spots that put like two pieces of tofu and three pieces of broccoli and think that that's a bowl of soup. This place charges EXACTLY what you would pay for pho but gives you SO MUCH MORE for your money's worth. LOVE IT!!!! My boyfriend loved his soup as well, he ate all of his, I took half of mine home and ate it later mmmm:). 

My server was the cutest thing ever I am SO bummed I didn't get her name. My boyfriend asked for another lemon for his soup and she brought him five, LOVE IT! As a waitress myself, I give her service five stars :) No complaints here!!!

I will definitely be returning.
Thank You The Citrus Club!
author: Courtney S.

description:
I have been to this place several time and it was always decently good. But last night was a joke.  
We stood there waiting for a table for 20mins, when there was an open table the entire time, which we were sat at.
Then the 3 of use ordered our meals and they all came out at different times. I'm not joking, we literally watched my boyfriend eat his food.  Then my friend got her food. And mine came out last after they were both done eating. 
To top it off, the food was horrible.  There was almost no seasoning.  The Pho was alright but nothing special.  The tiger shrimp curry was bland with no flavor.  And the Pad Thai was a joke and didn't taste like pad Thai should.

I will not be back, and I suggest you don't put yourself through the horrible experience we had.
author: Kara S.

description:
What a scrumptious surprise to stumble across on Haight Street! I would have never expected that this inconspicuous spot had such wonderful service and great food selections. 

I had the lemongrass coconut shrimp over jade noodles and I was in love. It's a huge portion and basically tastes like a southeast Asian fetuccine alfredo (but safe for lactose intolerants)! I was even more in love with my girl Jessica T's salmon over soba noodles. I will absolutely be ordering that next time I'm there. The fish was sooo flavorful! Unfortunately I wasn't a fan of the chicken and noodles with peanut sauce, but one flop out of three isn't bad at all - and I wouldn't even really call it a flop, just that I wasn't a huge fan of the flavors. 

The servers were so sweet, and though the food seemed to take kind of a long time, it was well worth it when it arrived. I would definitely come back here again and recommend it to anyone with hunger pangs in the area!
author: Christina P.

description: Just delicious! We had lunch at the counter, the service was pleasant, the food was remarkably fresh and flavorful. If I lived closer I would eat here all of time! Don't miss the Avocado Spring Rolls! Yum!
author: Nina J.

description:
This is one of my local favorites. Whenever I'm craving a giant steaming bowl of Pho, I will be going to the Citrus Club. 
There is hardly any wait to be seated, the food comes relatively promptly, and the staff is very accommodating and helpful. 
I jump between the Sa-Choy Vegetable Noodle Soup, and the Pho-Ga Chicken Noodle Soup, depending on if I need a huge veggie or protein kick. 
If I'm feeling extra hungry, I'll order the Beef Broccoli-Jade (spinich) Noodles, and will have left-overs that are great the next day. 
Thanks for being around for me for the 5 years or so I've been in SF!
author: Genevieve G.

description:
My wife and I came here all the time when we lived in the city. Now we go every time we visit. Great food, quick services. 

It's small and sometimes you have to wait for a table but it's worth it. The only reason I give it 4 stars is sometimes there's an odd smell in the restaurant. Can't quite tell what it is tho.
author: Justin M.

description: Citrus Club!! It was beyond five stars when I started going here in 2007. The food was always delicious. The vegan soba noodle soup has been my jam for years and before that, the various tofu and noodle dishes. Unfortunately the past half a dozen times I have been there, the place HEAVILY wreaked of bleach and cleaners. But I would suffer through it because the food is so amazing. But then I came to Yelp to write this review and noticed the safety advisor noting that the restaurant is not up to par in SF cleanliness standards. I'm not exactly surprised...
author: Sandy D.

description:
Started off great with the tofu roll and a bowl of ginger tea.  The peanut sauce with the rolls was excellent and I admit to eating the remainder of it straight.
The tofu pad thai was a letdown.   Ok but fairly bland.
author: Ric S.

description:
Citrus Club is by far the best eating option in the Upper Haight (outside of Club Deluxe on pizza nights and the Thai place which shares the same street). Whenever friends ask where to eat in the area - I never hesitate to recommend The Citrus Club. My mom and I, when she came to visit ,spent many a beautiful bonding moment here. I'd always get the soba noodles in garlic sauce with salmon - and my mom would order a tofu bowl. We'd share a pot of sweet ginger tea - and just talk...until dusk would start to set in.

Memories are so much more precious when good food is involved.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
It was ok. I had the garlic edamame and seaweed salad with tofu and mine was all great.  The garlic edamame is a truly magnificent twist on this classic.

My husband had the thai chicken Salad. I was like done eating by the time they got him his food but I saw the salad they gave him and it was made a bit before that.

Not sure if it is related but he did get sick later for the rest of that day and through most of the next.  I was fine however.

Decent food but I've had better Thai in that area.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Stumbled into The Citrus Club after a few hours of shopping on Haight. Was pleasantly surprised with the service! I got up for two minutes from my table and my appetizer was there when I returned. Recommend the avacado spring rolls for all my fello avo lovers, very generous portion. The citrus sauce was a delicious citrus and spice combination as well. Went with the Se-Choy vegetable soup and was incredibly surprised by the size. Such a bang for your buck! Not to mention delicious.
author: Jenni M.

description:
Some nights you don't want to be fancy. You don't want to wait in line with all the pretty, gaunt, un-showered SF folk. You don't want to see another menu of small plates, or 'family style' grub, or molecular works of edible art. You just want a big bowl of noodles all to yourself, dammit!

On these nights, you should take your cheap, greedy, noodle-craving bum to the Citrus Club. You absolutely can't go wrong. 

It's a small place, and gets easily packed. But trust me...stick around, the tables turn fast, and the saucy dishes are worth the wait. On this particular Thursday they happily let us snag seats at the bar, without any bureaucratic chastisement from a hostess. First come, first-served; the way God intended. I like this place already! 

We debated over the long, luscious menu of noodle stuffs - all incredibly well-priced, with appetizers from $5-8 and mains from $8-13. And look at those plates! Someone is taking home leftovers, that's for sure. I ordered the Zaru Soba appetizer (buckwheat noodles, seaweed, fresh tofu and wasabi), a generous mound that could have been my meal. But I can never resist those Vietnamese spring rolls and the delish allergy-inducing peanut sauce (yes, I'm officially allergic, but not ready to quit). The spring rolls were sliced up into 6 shareable pieces, and the sauce was thick and spicy, just the way mama likes it. I also tasted Jojo's coconut curry noodles: creamy, carby, spice-a-liciousness, with plenty for lunch the next day.

Service was impressively prompt considering how packed they were, and the dude behind the bar was sweet enough to 1) plug in my friend's cell phone to let it charge while we ate, and 2) run out into the street with her credit card, which she'd dropped on the floor after we paid. Double unnecessary-niceness points! 

I officially heart this place. I sure hope they don't raise their prices to match their popularity. Either way, I'll be dreaming of my next noodle binge.
author: Nique F.

description:
Came here for the first time today and my food was EXCELLENT! I got some kind of shrimp curry plate and it was a huge portion of perfectly spicy noodles. 

My friend got some basil shrimp noodles that seemed a little bland... Not bad, just a little boring. But points back on for great service... Our waitress filled our water cups just about after every sip.
author: Jasmine H.

description: The web site says their open till 11. I came in for a to go order at 10:43 and they said they were closed. Done eating here.
author: Isaac S.

description: I've never been disappointed by The Citrus Club. They consistently serve excellent food. The portions are very large so you're definitely getting a big bang for your buck but the quality somehow remains intact. I'm not sure how they do it. Despite there being a long line at times, I always seem to get seated pretty quickly. The servers are very friendly and are very good about keeping you hydrated, which I appreciate. I usually order the Chicken Noodle Soup or Vegetable Soup with Rice Noodles. Their soups are MSG free and have a lot of flavor.
author: Raha G.

description: First time here and it was amazing!!! Big portions and amazing taste. I had Thai iced tea and chicken noodle soup! Yumm!!! I am coming back and bringing my friends!
author: Erica R.

description: Decent place. Not great, not terrible. Would come back to try something else. There are a lot of options on the menu, including vegetarian ones. We had the peanut noodles and they were pretty salty, but still satisfying.
author: Anastasia J.

description:
Meh. A-ok.
Last time i have been here was about 5 years ago and i thought i liked it back then but this time around.. not so much. My pad thai was just bleh. Spring rolls were ok. Beef soup.. friend said it was good..nothing made an impression, i will not go back.
author: C A.

description:
Oh Citrus Club, not sure if I just ordered wrong or if your food is not as good as it used to be. We ordered the Tom Ka coconut tofu soup and it was awful. It lacked any real flavor and was just pure cream tasting. Where was the flavor? We also ordered the ginger chicken with garlic noodles. The chicken was nicely charbroiled but other than that was not impressed.

Service was really great. Attentive and friendly hostess and servers. So, at least they had that going for them. So, my two stars are simply on the food alone.
author: Laura A.

description:
Oh Citrus Club, what happened to you?!? You used to be a place I'd bring out of town guests in search of noodles. Now you're just another mediocre Upper Haight service. 

The food has definitely declined over the years. Bland and very inconsistent.
author: Eraculon S.

description:
This place is small and crowded.
Its a perfect for a cold,rainy day in SF.
I had beer, sake, ramen. 
It was tasty and the bowls are HUGGGEE!
come in after smoking that KALI KUSH!!! hahahaha
author: Loulou D.

description:
Yummy stir fry noodle dishes. Ambiance is annoying and loud. 

The kitchen needs a scrub down! I mean it's visible from the bar.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I want to like this place so much. I love this type of food, it's super close to my house, it's open late, it's cheap, and they have booze. So many great things! Unfortunately, the food is just not that great. 

My boyfriend once ordered some sort of noodle stir-fry that was watery and bland, in fact every stir-fried noodle dish I've had here was underwhelming. The spring rolls and papaya salad are ok, I'll give them that. Also, the hot and sour noodle soup was pretty good. 

I've only been here a handful of times so maybe I just haven't been ordering the right things. I'm sure I'll continue to come back many times due to proximity and my late dinner habits, but if I didn't live so close I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Decent prices for a lot of food. 

Taste is hit or miss. I often find myself wishing they served the authentic version over their odd fusion version. 

Recommend pad thai. Their ramen tastes odd and their peanut sauce noodles lack.. something. 

Dimly lit. Usually no wait.
author: Gee H.

description: Huge scary portions. One order will feed a family of 4. The size of the food was overwhelming. I didn't like the taste at all. Quite bland for me. The servers  were not friendly either.
author: Prima B.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I am a local and have been eating at this restaurant regularly for more than two years. 

Their soups are a great deal (you'll get enough for 2 in one order), but the quality is inconsistent. The amount of noodles and broth vary from day to day, and if they skimp on broth, they charge an additional fee when you ask for more.

The staff is generally friendly, but recently they got some new people, who definitely do not understand the meaning of customer service. A few weeks ago, my friend and I received the wrong soup with our order. When we asked for the correct soup, she said I would have to pay for it since I had ordered it. However, when I explained that there was no way I ordered the soup since I am allergic to its ingredients, she insisted that I was wrong. To her credit, I do not remember the exact words or moment that I ordered the soup, but I was disappointed that she would not give a regular customer the benefit of the doubt. I know others who have experienced this, too. 

If you want a cheap meal on a cold night, this place may make your belly very happy, but this and other locals' experiences have left me jaded about this place. With so many great restaurants in the area offering high quality food at that price point, I've only been back once.
author: Kristen M.

description: I had high hopes for this restaurant business but was disappointed. We waited approx. 25 minutes for food only to receive food that was lacking flavor. The coconut curry chicken was bland and didn't pack the flavor you would expect from a Thai restaurant. The portion of the soup is fairly large, however the quality was only okay.
author: Josh S.

description:
Peanut noodles and chicken sticks in peanut sauce = the bomb

it never came back to haunt me
author: Drawing G.

description:
Some things that I like:

-Portions are humungo for their price. 
-The restaurant has a very warm intimate vibe, very relaxing. Sitting at the booth makes me want to roll over and lie down for a bit. 
-The bbq tofu spring rolls are GOOD. They have yet to fail me. And the coconut dipping sauce harmonizes perfectly with it! YUM. 

Some things I did not like so much:
-The host, I believe, told us to wrap things up because another group wanted the table. I understand this to a degree, but find it a bit odd for a host to ask their customers to just leave. 
-Some of the menu items are bland. The soup this time was underflavored. Half a bottle of hoisin and generous squeezes of sriracha couldn't save it. I think the beef pho had only two thin slices of beef in it. 

Willing to try this place again  for a third time. The pad thai looked appetizing anyway.
author: Vaneza A.

description:
My buddies and I needed somewhere to grab a quick bite before heading off to the Metreon for Avatar in IMAX 3D.  Since the tickets were nearly $20, we were looking for something affordable and tasty, so my friend recommended the Pan-Asian fusion Citrus Club.  It turned out to be a great tip.

I ordered the Thai coconut soup with shrimp wontons and rice noodles.  Arriving in a huge bowl, there was a ton of soup to enjoy.  For only $8.95, it was a tremendous value considering how much food you got.  There weren't really that many wontons and even the noodles were a bit sparse, but there's no denying that it was a lot to eat.  I felt like the vegetables were cut way too big which ruined the texture a bit, but the flavors were all there.  Overall, it wasn't perfect but it was a pretty tasty bargain.

The core of the restaurant is Thai, but I think there's something for everybody at The Citrus Club to enjoy.  It's obviously very popular and turned out to be a fun place to get a meal.  It's not great for large parties and our group of 3 was forced to eat from the bar, but at the end of the day, the food, price, and experience all balanced out nicely.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
- Huge portions, ask 1 for 2-3 people!
- Everything I tried so far was tasty except dumpling soup
- Long lines in the evening! 
- The waiters are kinda forcing you to do everything fast and to go away quickly after you are done eating 
- The restaurant is small and dark
- Problems parking on Haight in the evening
author: Maria O.

description: So I'm strolling around the Height and Ashbury area and I stumbled across this place. It was pretty decent and if I was in the area I'd try it again.  I had the beef noodle soup. Had a decent crowd not to busy not to quite.
author: Maurice D.

description: The soju Cosmo was surprisingly good. The food itself was pretty good. Would try again.
author: Heather R.

description: Giving two stars only because the service I had today was kind and informative. I have been here many times. I've brought family and friends raving about the yummy food and large bowls. I don't eat fish and have asked on all occasions to not have any fish sauce/oyster sauce in my food, multiple servers and kitchen staff have assured me previously that what I was ordering was fish free. Sadly, today a server who actually CARED told me that the items I have ordered in the past DO contain fish sauce. This is extremely disappointing on many levels. I have worked in restaurants for over 15 years and know that customers put their trust in a server to insure their allergies or diet needs are met but Citrus Club has failed to either educate their staff or care about diet needs. I choose not to eat fish but I know many people who are allergic. Shame on you Citrus Club for not caring about the diet needs of your customers.
author: Eryn L.

description: Great prices great variety! They had green papaya which is my favorite! Fast service too!
author: Mak N.

description:
This little "hole in the wall" on Haight is a place that I hit up once a week to have dinner with the bestie.  We talk, laugh, cry, and bitch about our week over a bowl of Hot and Sour Soup or the Coconut Soup with Shrimp.  Though we have always discussed that we would try something new on the menu, we always resort to the soups, which are perfect compliments to one of the many cold days here in SF. I tried the pad thai once and found it unappealing and tasteless.  The soup is the item to come here for. 

Also, the service is hit or miss.  On most occasions, we get an amazing server.  However, there is one that tends to ignore us after we have had started on our third beer.  I have uttered many unfathomable names under my breath in relation to that server.  But, alas, it has never deterred me from coming to our weekly soup spot.

100% give it a try!!!
author: Jenn S.

description:
Really looked forward to this place. The sign up front said something along the lines of best soup. Thus I ordered the beef pho soup. The size of the portion is good, but it didn't have a lot of beef. I only had 4 pieces with lots of noodles on top of that the broth was pretty bland. I didn't really enjoy my first time at this place.

The buser I have to say was the hero of the night he was very attentive. He frequently came ovet to refill our waters and to clear up the plates. If it wasn't for him I'd give this place 2 stars. 

Worth giving this place a 2nd shot.
author: Maly B.

description:
